references.paper_title: The multimodal brain tumor image segmentation benchmark (brats)
references.reason: This paper introduces the BraTS challenge, a significant benchmark dataset and evaluation platform for brain tumor segmentation that has driven much of the field's progress.

references.paper_title: The multimodal brain tumor image segmentation benchmark (brats)
references.reason: This foundational paper established the BraTS challenge, a widely used benchmark for brain tumor segmentation that has spurred substantial research and development in the field.

references.paper_title: Segmentation labels and radiomic features for the pre-operative scans of the tcga-lgg collection
references.reason: This paper provides a detailed description of the dataset and features used in the BraTS challenge, significantly contributing to the reproducibility and comparability of research.
This paper presents nnU-Net, a widely adopted and highly effective architecture for brain tumor segmentation, demonstrating the importance of this model in the field.

references.paper_title: The brain tumor segmentation (brats) challenge 2023: glioma segmentation in sub-saharan africa patient population (brats-africa)
references.reason: This paper highlights the importance of addressing data bias and distribution shift in the development of robust brain tumor segmentation models, showcasing the impact of this challenge on improving the generalizability of models.
